content:
All right for me.
Example and tests work fine !
Pretty cool puzzle !

The last validator has 138 lines, but says 150 on its first line.
I'll edit it but shame on those that approved it...

Oh well, I guess in some languages you'll just get empty string instead of error so maybe that's why they missed it. I'll forgive them this time.

At first glance I thought too easy, you just find the min row and times it by number of rows.  But then I saw that you can remove short rows at the bottom to make larger rectangles (thanks for using an example that does that, I appreciate that).

I have a working solution in Ruby under a 100 chars.

Nice puzzle.
I think this is also good for reverse mode, not really hard to guess with that "pi" testcase

My only concern there is whether or not they'll understand not to cut off the title.

Currently there's only two test cases where that is relevant, and they're at the end and one of them is very big.
I swear I checked with a line counter that none of the inputs got cut off. Guess it wasn't so accurate :/ Thanks for the catch
